title: Contact UK visas and immigration NOT THIS VERSION

body.content:
##You're inside the UK

You can contact UK visas and immigration (UKVI) from inside the UK to:

- check your visa or immigration application status
- ask a question

##You're outside the UK

You can contact UK visas and immigration (UKVI) from outside the UK to ask a question.

You’re inside the UK

You can contact UK visas and immigration (UKVI) from inside the UK to:

  • check your visa or immigration application status
  • ask a question

You’re outside the UK

You can contact UK visas and immigration (UKVI) from outside the UK to ask a question.

options.label: Visas and settlement (indefinite leave to remain)

nodes.title: What language do you want to use?

body.content:
Choose the language you want to use:

- to speak to someone on the phone
- to get a reply by email

Choose the language you want to use:

  • to speak to someone on the phone
  • to get a reply by email

UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) [aims to process](/government/organisations/uk-visas-and-immigration/about/about-our-services) all applications for citizenship, naturalisation and nationality within 6 months. You'll be sent a letter from UKVI after 6 months to update you on the progress of your application. You don't need to contact UKVI about this. ##Check your citizenship application status To check your application status you'll need either your: - reference number - application number

Check your application status

$C **Citizenship and nationality enquiries** Telephone: 0300 123 2253 Monday to Thursday, 9am to 5pm Friday, 9am to 4:30pm [Find out about call charges](/call-charges) $C *[UKVI]: UK Visas and Immigration

UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) aims to process all applications for citizenship, naturalisation and nationality within 6 months.

You’ll be sent a letter from UKVI after 6 months to update you on the progress of your application. You don’t need to contact UKVI about this.

Check your citizenship application status

To check your application status you’ll need either your:

  • reference number
  • application number

Check your application status

Citizenship and nationality enquiries nationalityenquiries@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk
Telephone: 0300 123 2253
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 5pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

If you’re a national of an EEA country or Switzerland you can check the status of your: - permanent residence document - registration certificate - derivative residence card If you’re the partner or family member of a national of an EEA country or Switzerland you can check the status of your: - UK residence card - EEA family permit - derivative residence card To check your application status you'll need either your: - reference number - application number

Check your application status

$C **Enquiries from European citizens** Telephone: 0300 123 2253 Monday to Thursday, 9am to 5pm Friday, 9am to 4:30pm [Find out about call charges](/call-charges) $C You may be able to find the information you need on GOV.UK about [EU, EEA, Commonwealth citizens](/browse/visas-immigration/eu-eea-commonwealth) and [working in the UK as a Croatian national](/croatian-national). ^There will be no change to the [rights and status of EU nationals living in the UK, nor UK nationals living in the EU](https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/uk-leaving-the-eu-what-you-need-to-know), while the UK remains in the EU.^

If you’re a national of an EEA country or Switzerland you can check the status of your:

  • permanent residence document
  • registration certificate
  • derivative residence card

If you’re the partner or family member of a national of an EEA country or Switzerland you can check the status of your:

  • UK residence card
  • EEA family permit
  • derivative residence card

To check your application status you’ll need either your:

  • reference number
  • application number

Check your application status

Enquiries from European citizens
Telephone: 0300 123 2253
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 5pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

You may be able to find the information you need on GOV.UK about EU, EEA, Commonwealth citizens and working in the UK as a Croatian national.

There will be no change to the rights and status of EU nationals living in the UK, nor UK nationals living in the EU, while the UK remains in the EU.

You can check the status of your application for your: - work visa, including your dependents - student visa - settlement (indefinite leave to remain) - family of a settled person visa To check your application status you'll need either your: - reference number - application number

Check your application status

Phone the UK Visas and Immigration contact centre about: + settlement + extending your stay in the UK + work and study visas + other general immigration enquiries + the Immigration Rules ^Fill in a form to [get your passport or other documents back](/visa-documents-returned) urgently. $C **UK Visas and Immigration contact centre** Telephone: 0300 123 2241 Textphone: 0800 389 8289 Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm Friday, 9am to 4:30pm [Find out about call charges](/call-charges) $C ##Turkish European Community Association Agreement (ECAA) applications You can write to or fax the Turkish ECAA team to find out about your application. You'll need to include your: - name - date of birth - visa reference number (if you have one) $C **Turkish ECAA team** Fax: 0870 336 9622 $C $A Turkish IAU PO Box 3468 Sheffield S3 8WA $A ###If you haven't applied yet Contact the UK Visas and Immigration contact centre for information on general Turkish ECAA visas. *[UKVI]: UK Visas and Immigration *[ECAA]: European Community Association Agreement *[IAU]: Initial Assessment Unit

You can check the status of your application for your:

  • work visa, including your dependents
  • student visa
  • settlement (indefinite leave to remain)
  • family of a settled person visa

To check your application status you’ll need either your:

  • reference number
  • application number

Check your application status

Phone the UK Visas and Immigration contact centre about:

  • settlement
  • extending your stay in the UK
  • work and study visas
  • other general immigration enquiries
  • the Immigration Rules

Fill in a form to get your passport or other documents back urgently.

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: 0300 123 2241
Textphone: 0800 389 8289
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

Turkish European Community Association Agreement (ECAA) applications

You can write to or fax the Turkish ECAA team to find out about your application.

You’ll need to include your:

  • name
  • date of birth
  • visa reference number (if you have one)

Turkish ECAA team
Fax: 0870 336 9622

Turkish IAU
PO Box 3468
Sheffield
S3 8WA

If you haven’t applied yet

Contact the UK Visas and Immigration contact centre for information on general Turkish ECAA visas.

Contact the employer and education helpline for information about sponsoring an employee or student. 

$C
**Employer and education helpline**   
Telephone: 0300 123 4699   
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm   
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm    
[Find out about call charges](/call-charges)   
$C

##Business helpdesk

Contact <businesshelpdesk@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk> if you have questions about an application and you're a business, its representative or a Tier 1 investor. 

##Educators' helpdesk

Contact <educatorshelpdesk@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk> if you work at a UK educational establishment or are a Tier 4 sponsor.


*[UKVI]: UK Visas and Immigration

Contact the employer and education helpline for information about sponsoring an employee or student.

Employer and education helpline
Telephone: 0300 123 4699
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

Business helpdesk

Contact businesshelpdesk@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk if you have questions about an application and you’re a business, its representative or a Tier 1 investor.

Educators’ helpdesk

Contact educatorshelpdesk@homeoffice.gsi.gov.uk if you work at a UK educational establishment or are a Tier 4 sponsor.

Contact the asylum customer contact centre if you have questions about your asylum support application - including your weekly cash support, accommodation or emergency cash payments.

$C
**Asylum customer contact centre**   
Telephone: 0300 123 2235   
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 5pm   
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm    
[Find out about call charges](/call-charges)   
$C

##Asylum applications submitted before 5 March 2007

There's a different number for asylum applications submitted before 5 March 2007.

$C
Telephone: 0151 213 4288  
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm   
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm    
[Find out about call charges](/call-charges)   
$C

Contact the asylum customer contact centre if you have questions about your asylum support application - including your weekly cash support, accommodation or emergency cash payments.

Asylum customer contact centre
Telephone: 0300 123 2235
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 5pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

Asylum applications submitted before 5 March 2007

There’s a different number for asylum applications submitted before 5 March 2007.

Telephone: 0151 213 4288
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

$C
**Phone enquiries**   
Telephone: 00 44 1234 218 116  
Monday to Friday, 10am to 6pm UK time

Calls cost £1.37 per minute on top of your normal network charge.  
$C

**Email enquiries**  
You can [email UKVI to get a response in English](https://ukvi-prototype.herokuapp.com/SelectPaymentType) using a secure payment server. 

Emails cost £5.48

You'll get a reply within one day, except on weekends and [public holidays](https://www.gov.uk/bank-holidays).

Phone enquiries
Telephone: 00 44 1234 218 116
Monday to Friday, 10am to 6pm UK time

Calls cost £1.37 per minute on top of your normal network charge.

Email enquiries

Emails cost £5.48

You’ll get a reply within one day, except on weekends and public holidays.
